title: The Enlightened Dad: A Real Man's Survival Guide For The First Years Of Fatherhood
features: Take a humorous approach to what is often the most stressful time in a man’s life with

Drawing from personal experiences and real life scenarios, authors Andy Geesen and Bart Allan—who have five kids between them—provide a no-nonsense approach to everything from the reality of changing the first diaper to the horror known as breastfeeding.

Meant as a “guy’s guide” to pregnancy and the early stages of fatherhood, this is the perfect gift for any male who is excited about the idea of being a dad and yet can still be found standing at the bar watching the game during the baby shower.
Men and women alike will find joy in this funny, lighthearted, and, above all, honest look at fatherhood. Who knows? It might even give wives some insight into how their husbands
feel about the impending blessed event…

description: Bart Allan, a self-proclaimed accomplished author, has been writing magazine and online articles for fifteen years. Allan's writings cover a wide array of subjects, from transportation to pop culture.

Andy Geesen, a relative newcomer to the literary world, is an experienced technical writer with expertise in the fields of energy, real estate, and insurance. He claims to have further honed his writing skills-and emotional compass-with the occasional sappy proclamation in greeting cards to his wife.
